title: Watch: Black dad hammers school for teaching daughter her white mom's 'evil' and somehow that's not the bad part
description:
In 2021, the largest teachers' union in the country just voted to promote CRT in schools. All 50 states, all 14,000 school districts. Using the pandemic to show how much the teachers' unions hate parents and students was just the warm-up act. The NEA (National Educators Association) said CRT is coming. Democrats have to think up a new lie about CRT being a Fox News myth. That makes videos like this all the more important to amplify. This father has an issue with the idea of white people being evil being promoted to his kids. I'm sure their white mother isn't thrilled about it either.

Amazing parent testimony on Critical Race Theory in our schools. pic.twitter.com/Llbe0yBn4U
— James Lindsay, uncitable (@ConceptualJames) July 5, 2021

"The problem with bringing [CRT] to the high school and grade school level is that we don't have the educators to properly teach these kids. Instead, they're using it as their own agenda to indoctrinate kids to hate each other. Whether you believe that to be true or not, the reality is that's what happening. Critical race theory is teaching that white people are bad. That's not true. That would teach my daughter that her mother's evil."

Hold on to your butts. That's NOT the bad part.

"You already have an educator within your staff that has pulled my daughter aside and said, 'Well, you're a minority, so you know better than to engage in certain things.' When it was brought to the school's attention, nothing happened to the educator. Instead, my daughter was brought in and she was ridiculed."

Wow.

This dad is a better man than I am. If it were me, I'd be one of those crazy people the sergeant-at-arms was dragging out of the school. He realized the camera was on him and had a more important point to make. That STARTED with him pointing out what CRT was and who specifically it was meant for. HINT: not grade-schoolers.

The teachers' unions care more about their Marxist ideology than they ever did about students or parents. Democrats like Joe Biden and his White House will do whatever the unions tell them to as long as the money is on the nightstands. It's more important than ever for the people to stand together.

title: WATCH: Joy Behar Makes an Oopsie, Condemns McCarthy's Handling of January 6th 'Erection' Footage
description:
We once again must discuss something that happened on The View. Who else is going to keep them on air? They're depending on our hate views now more than ever.

The ladies of The View are very unhappy that Kevin McCarthy decided to hand over 40,000 hours of January 6th footage to Tucker Carlson. Which I personally find to be pretty baller. But Joy Behar disagrees. She condemned McCarthy's action and called into question Tucker's credibility, before accidentally referring to the insurrection as an "erection".

That's right. Behar said, "McCarthy hands [Tucker Carlson] more than 40,000 hours of...footage from the January 6th ERECTION."

\u201cBEHAR: "McCarthy hands [@TuckerCarlson] him more than 40,000 hours of...footage from the January 6th ERECTION."\u201d
— Daily Caller (@Daily Caller) 1677083730

Behar is not the first leftist to make this mistake. Who could forget when Chuck Schumer had the same slip of the tongue while discussing Trump's very serious and totally not-at-all sham second impeachment?

\u201cThis moment will live on in our hearts forever.\u201d
— Kevin McMahon (@Kevin McMahon) 1641483868

Lead Impeachment Manager Senator Jamie Raskin said the same thing. And so did Rep Adam Schiff. Why do so many Democrats have erections on the brain all the time?

\u201cRaskin said Trump incited an erection \u201d
— Bobby D. (@Bobby D.) 1671562028


\u201cOops! Adam Schiff says Trump incited "an erection" on The View. \ud83e\udd26\u200d\u2640\ufe0f\u201d
— Alexandra Datig | Front Page Index \ud83c\uddfa\ud83c\uddf8 (@Alexandra Datig | Front Page Index \ud83c\uddfa\ud83c\uddf8) 1636485352

Bizarre sexual slip-ups aside, Behar went on to express her disgust for Kevin McCarthy. She whined that "people died on January 6th" and asked, "Isn't McCarthy the real culprit here...How does he stand up straight without a spine?"

\u201cBEHAR: "People were killed...People died on January 6th."\u201d
— Daily Caller (@Daily Caller) 1677085796


\u201cBEHAR: "Isn't McCarthy the real culprit here...How does he stand up straight without a spine?"\u201d
— Daily Caller (@Daily Caller) 1677086021

Behar is correct that people died on January 6th. Four people, in fact. Ashli Babbitt is the only one mainstream media will report was killed by Capitol Police. But three other people died under highly suspicious circumstances, with some video evidence suggesting police may have played a role.

And Officer Brian Sicknick died of natural causes on January 7th. But before we knew that, the media claimed he was beaten to death by a fire extinguisher, then killed by bear-spray-yielding rioters. Neither claims were true.

I'm guessing Joy Behar knows none of this. She's too focused on the erec- er, insurrection.

title: Watch As This Teenager Eviscerates His Woke School Board Over Blatant Anti-White Policies
description:
We've seen plenty of parents roasting school boards over the past few years. And it's been great. Hell hath no fury like a Mama Bear scorned. But perhaps even more inspiring is when the kids themselves take the pulpit to decry the indoctrination pushed relentlessly by our nation's public schools. There's something beautiful about seeing a 15-year-old put a bunch of woke adults in their place.

That's exactly what Brad Taylor, a (now former) student of RHS District 196 did. This clip is from 2021 but began recirculating today amongst Twitter peeps. The school Taylor is referring to seems to be Rosemont High School in Minnesota.

Taylor noted he had been a part of the school district for 10 years before diving into what he, a white, male student, experienced in these schools. He explained that on the first day of class, the principal gave a "heartfelt speech" about equality and listed out a bunch of races. But he notably excluded one race. Any guesses which?

Taylor said of the incident, "To be clear, I don't need you to tell me that I matter. But hearing the condolences given to other races, and leaving just one race out, inevitably, you start to feel like you've done something wrong."

\u201cTeenager Exposes Woke School Board, Renders Them Speechless In Five Minute Mic Drop Speech\n\nThis kid is going places.\n\nH/T @dbongino\u201d
— Red Voice Media (@Red Voice Media) 1677005377

Taylor described another incident where he was told writing "All Lives Matter" on the whiteboard was political and offensive. Even though there apparently were BLM signs all over the school. The school officials told him "BLM" was a human rights statement, not a political one. Mmhmm. Sure.

Then he got to the most egregious event: when Taylor asked why the school's equity statement couldn't include all races, the school told him, "Whites have a pretty good situation right now." Therefore, we can't be included. In anything. Sorry whites.

The devastating impact of these policies seems to be - surprise - heightened importance placed on race. Taylor said that, after a year at the school, race has become one of the first things he notices about people, which was never the case prior to attending RHS. It's almost like constantly dividing people and demonizing one race leads to more racism. Weird.

At the end of the speech, Taylor announced he was leaving the school before delivering his final mic drop moment: "I will never stop believing that everybody has value, no matter their skin color or personal beliefs. And it's a shame that you're not going to be able to say that I was an alumni of RHS District 196."

It's been nearly two years since Taylor left the school. My guess is he's doing well since he's no longer being told to hate himself every day. Which is always a plus.

title: Joe Rogan, Ryan Long debate if Canadian shop teacher is a dude: 'Wearing those t*tties all day would be nuts'
description:
The internet was shook this week. It was reported by the New York Post that beautiful and brave Canadian shop teacher Kayla Lemieux was ACKSHUALLY a dude. One who only puts on a pair of size-Z prothetic chesticles (with rock-hard nipples) "to teach, occasionally when (s)he goes for a walk or when the cops visit." In a subsequent story to The Post, Kayla claims to not be that dude. Also, her size-Z boobs are ALL NATURAL BABY and the result of a genetic condition.

What's the truth? Is Kayla a guy or nah? Joe Rogan and Ryan Long did a deep dive on the story and analyzed further.

“You have to leave room for crazy when it comes to trans people too and right now they don’t”

Joe Rogan and Ryan Long discuss the Woke insanity of the Canadian ‘trans’ shop teacher. pic.twitter.com/vAtBiT6ykP
— Mythinformed MKE (@MythinformedMKE) February 22, 2023

As Long says, having to strap on those ginormous ti*tties all day sounds exhausting. A more manageable d-cup could even cause back problems. Rogan agrees and claims without evidence that he thinks Kayla is running a con.

Rogan is not alone. Last fall the anon boards started to report the teacher -- when identifying as a male -- was almost fired for "toxic masculinity" and would tell his shop class of impressional young boys how silly the idea of things like gender-neutral bathrooms is?

He's now upping the ante to exploit the very clown world the school and society itself has created. His long game is most likely to get fired, then sue for discrimination.

The hysterical thing is if it is a long con, how many people took this seriously in the name of "inclusion" and "equity." Think about the number of times that school boards and other Canadian officials have ruled that Kayla is in "fact" a woman. Only to find out that the man behind the fun bags is a based dude making a cultural point.

As of today, Kayla claims she's a woman. The AP Styleguide tells us that makes her a woman no questions asked.

For more on LWCs around the clock, team coverage of KaylaGhazi...

  • Students threatened with suspension, forbidden from taking any more photos of Kayla Lemieux
  • Shop teacher Kayla Lemieux with those enormous fake knockers debuts their new poolside look
  • Trans teacher with ginormous fake breasts sneaks into children's dance recital, asked to leave by parents
  • Our favorite beautiful and brave 'chesty' shop teacher goes skydiving, but not all of 'her' makes it
  • Shop teacher Kayla Lemieux with those enormous fake knockers debuts their new poolside look

title: Watch: As Waffle House chaos erupts behind him, dude is too busy enjoying his grits to be bothered
description:
Once in a while, content comes around that teaches a lesson as well as entertains you by watching people wild out in public. This is such a video. As chaos unfolds around you and is out of your control, sometimes you have to let it happen and eat your grits. That's what our man here did. We can learn a thing or two following his lead.

The following takes place in Jacksonville (DUUUUUUVAL). Where Jacksonville and late nights at the Waffle House are both their own mood.

Dinner and a show 🤣 pic.twitter.com/hjHyBHpITd
— Clown World ™ 🤡 (@ClownWorld_) February 22, 2023

The incident in question is tame as far as Waffle House goes. It's hardly up there with Fists Of Rage, Chair Ninja, or Your Titty Is Out. I'd put it just before Sassy Pants. Yes, we name all our Waffle House stories. It's a niche genre.

Our background story tale as old as time. Guy and girl get into an argument. Girl throws plastic utensils.

Guy retaliates with orange drink. Only he misses the girl and hits her coworker with a face full of Orange Juice. At least I hope it was orange juice. It was a little yellowish and I can think of something else that could be in the cup.

But the true hero had nothing to do with the skirmish. It's not even the customer with their smartphone out remembering to do it for the content. The true hero is our guy who looked over his shoulder, laughed because that is such a Waffle House thing to happen and went back to enjoying his grits. He was in his happy place. The fight didn't concern him. And those were some good f*cking grits.

Lesson learned. Whatever the "Waffle House beatdown" is in your life that is out of your control, find your grits and enjoy them. The world would be a better place if everyone ignored the bullshit and enjoyed their grits.

Editor’s Note

title: A Clinton Aide With Epstein Ties Committed Suicide By Shooting Himself in the Chest. Oh, And There's No Gun.
description:
Hypothetically speaking, if you were a detective and you came across a case of a deceased individual with a gunshot wound to the chest, an extension cord around his neck tied to a tree limb, and no weapon, would you conclude it was a suicide? No? Well, what if the Clintons were involved?

This is exactly what happened to Mark Middleton, who passed away last May. Middleton was Bill Clinton's special advisor. Oh, and he also happened to sign Jeffrey Epstein into the White House several times. No biggie.

Middleton was 59 years old at the time of his death. His body was discovered at the Heifer Ranch in Perryville, Arkansas. Perry County Sheriff's Deputy Jeremy Lawson said of the scene, "I could see what at first appeared to be a man sitting near a tree, as my eyes focused better, I could see a rope of some type going from the tree limb to the male. I could see that he had a gunshot wound to the chest and that he had a knot tied in an extension cord that was around his neck and it was attached to the limb directly above him."

\u201cEXCLUSIVE: Death of Clinton aide linked to Jeffrey Epstein found shot and tied to a tree with an electrical cord around his neck is ruled a SUICIDE https://t.co/R1E8kfNjP8\u201d
— Daily Mail US (@Daily Mail US) 1677072462

The police searched Middleton's vehicle and discovered three boxes of buckshot and a gun case, but no weapon.

Apart from signing Epstein into the White House, Middleton also flew on Epstein's famed "Lolita Express". He left the White House in 1995 and was accused of making himself into an international deal-maker. A 1996 investigation found Middleton had abused his access to impress business clients and he was subsequently banned from the White House.

But don't worry, I'm sure all is well. It makes perfect sense for someone to commit suicide by shooting themselves in the chest and disappearing the weapon. And it's not like an unseemly number of people involved with the Clintons have died under suspicious circumstances or anything. Nope, nothing to see here. Move along.

title: Watch: Pete Buttigieg bizarrely (and creepily) photographs reporter who confronts him about East Palestine
description:
Pete Buttigieg is not to be bothered during his 'personal time'. Nor his paternity leave. Those babies aren't gonna chest feed themselves.

Jennie Taer, a reporter with Daily Caller, approached Mayor Pete on the street last night to ask about the East Palestine crisis. Buttigieg responded with snark, saying, "Well I'd refer you to about a dozen interviews I've given today." He refused to reiterate the comments he gave during those interviews. He was too busy taking some "personal time" to walk down the street.

After Jennie asked if he planned to visit East Palestine, Buttigieg asked to take a photo of her. Presumably, because he felt she was harassing him. By doing her job. The nerve.

\u201cI asked Secretary Buttigieg about the crisis in East Palestine and I guess he didn\u2019t like that so he took a pic of me. Im just doing my job, sir. @DailyCaller\u201d
— Jennie Taer (@Jennie Taer) 1677025793

Pete Buttigieg and Joe Biden still have yet to visit East Palestine since the catastrophic train derailment. Instead, Biden went to Ukraine, and Pete Buttigieg apparently took some personal time. Priorities, people!

Donald Trump is actually heading to East Palestine today, and will reportedly donate thousands of gallons of cleaning supplies, 13 pallets of water, and meet with members of the community.

\u201cBREAKING: Donald Trump will reportedly donate thousands of gallons of cleaning supplies, along with 13 pallets of water and will meet with members of the community during his visit to East Palestine, Ohio.\u201d
— ALX \ud83c\uddfa\ud83c\uddf8 (@ALX \ud83c\uddfa\ud83c\uddf8) 1677073653

Despite Norfolk Southern and the government claiming all is well in East Palestine, residents have major concerns for their health. The water appears to have an oily rainbow sheen, and people have reported coughing, chemical burns, headaches, and generally feeling unwell from breathing the air.

\u201cMany videos going around showing the toxic water quality in East Palestine, Ohio. Few talking about the air quality. \n\nI spent the day there and afterward red rash irritation on the skin, sore throat, burning sensation on face and mouth. \n\nThe government is lying to you.\u201d
— Benny Johnson (@Benny Johnson) 1676593666

An environmental advocate told CBS News that the Ohio government and Norfolk Southern may have contaminated the water table when they dug a hole to fill it with the spilled chemicals and then lit it on fire. This could have contaminated the aquifer, the underground layer of water-bearing, permeable rock used for groundwater extraction. Which is very bad.

\u201c\u201cIt looks like the situation was mishandled on the upfront that created a worse scenario,\u201d says environmental advocate Erin Brockovich on the Ohio train derailment.\n\nShe tells @CBS_Herridge early procedures may have contaminated the water table in East Palestine.\u201d
— CBS News (@CBS News) 1676683685

So it certainly appears all is not well in East Palestine, despite the insistence of everyone in charge. I'm sure the residents are eagerly awaiting Pete Buttigieg's visit. Just after he finishes up his personal time, of course.

title: Guy who tried to shoot Kyle Rittenhouse is suing him for being a better shot
description:
Gaige Grosskreutz, a man who pointed his gun at Kyle Rittenhouse and attempted to shoot and kill Kyle Rittenhouse, is now suing Kyle Rittenhouse for shooting him in self-defense. Per Fox News, Grosskreutz wants punitive damages, economic losses, and, quote, "damages for emotional distress, humiliation, loss of enjoyment of life, and other pain and suffering on all claims."

A guy named Jacob Blake pulled a knife on police. Police shot him. Leftists and the media (but I repeat myself) didn't wait for facts to come in. Kenosha was burned and destroyed. CNN claimed the riots were "fiery but mostly peaceful protests." Kyle Rittenhouse showed up to help. Two men tried to kill him.

One was Gaige, who admitted under oath that he pulled his gun on Kyle first. The other was pedophile Joseph Rosenbaum, referred to affectionately by his progressive supporters as "JoJo." Rosenbaum is dead now. Gaige was only wounded.

In November of 2021, Rittenhouse was found not guilty on all murder charges.

Now Grosskreutz, who has an unrelated problem sitting upright, is looking for an easy payday. Rittenhouse tells Fox News he looks forward to proving his innocence AGAIN, adding "I guess it came as a shock to why he's filing a lawsuit because he admitted that he pointed a gun in my face and that he chased me down."

This lawsuit is an attempt to drown anyone who legally and justifiably defends there lives from attackers in a mountain of legal debt. We can not let them win. If they can come after me they will come after you. https://t.co/CJxXlGnUMO
— Kyle Rittenhouse (@ThisIsKyleR) February 21, 2023

You would think this cheap attempt for a payday would get thrown out. You'd also think a partisan District Attorney wouldn't elevate a clear self-defense case to murder one for political reasons. Justice can still be served, as it was for Kyle once. There are still people in our legal system hellbent on making it expensive for him again.

title: Watch: Smug teacher claims she knows what's best for your kids because she has a Masters's Degree and you don't
description:
Arizona is debating an education reform bill that would "empower parents to have a greater say in what their children are exposed to." One teacher speaking out against it was very helpful in exposing the attitude of "educators" pushing back on being told they can no longer indoctrinate children. She didn't mean to expose the attitude. She legit thinks she's more qualified to know what's best for your children. Though not qualified enough to know she's proving our point.

Meet Alicia Messing. She's upset at parents' lack of certification. (shout out to BizPacReview)

“I have a master’s degree. We all have advanced degrees!”

“What do the parents have? Are we vetting the backgrounds of our parents?” -Liberal white woman

She says the purpose of public education is to teach kids “what society needs them to be taught.”pic.twitter.com/9DLKlfibiy
— Billboard Chris 🇨🇦🇺🇸 (@BillboardChris) February 19, 2023

Side note: Really, Twitter?

Messing wanted to know if anyone was "vetting the parents." After all, the parents aren't qualified. They don't have the proper training.

I have a master’s degree because when I got certified. I was told I had to have a master’s degree to be an Arizona-certified teacher. We all have advanced degrees. What do the parents have?

They have their children.

If parents decide they no longer want math or English or history taught, that would be one thing. That's not what parents are angry about. They aren't angry about education. They're angry at indoctrination, something Messing obtained a Master's Degree in.

Most parents' complaints fall into one of three categories.

1. Schools that use every topic to divide students by race and convince one group to hate themselves all in the name of equity.

2. Teachers who straight up advertise their Marxist worldview IN the classroom.

3. The alarming amount of pornography available that, because the author checks off one or more boxes on the left's preferred marginalized chart, is called "award-winning."

Those are the things parents have a problem with. Teachers like Messing who are getting emotional about it are the very reason WHY there needs to be more parental choice in education.

title: Watch: Guy gets what he deserves after disrespecting UFC star's wife in front of their daughter
description:
Spoiler: Sign Guy is in fact the asshole here.

It's a Mardi Gras parade. Instead of trying to see boobies in exchange for beads like a normie, this dinkus felt it necessary to draw on a piece of oaktag and attempt to antagonize UFC Star Dustin Poirier as Poirier was driving by with his wife. Also, with his six-year-old daughter.

HARDOOOOOOO @DustinPoirier should’ve slept him

(via @TheArtOfWar6) pic.twitter.com/5XZWu5FYAm
— Spinnin Backfist (@SpinninBackfist) February 21, 2023

Some backstory. "Your wife's in my DMs" is a reference to Poirier's fight against Conor McGregor. The third fight where Poirier won by TKO when Conor broke his leg. As Conor sat in the Octagon after losing, he felt it necessary to take a shot at Dustin's wife. Sign Guy was so impressed by McGregor's actions, he held on to the quote for a year and a half. And when he heard Poirier was going to be in the parade, it was time!

Bringing a dumb sign into an arena full of 20000 people is one thing. It's another to be a douchebag who poses with the sign, then has your friend film you as you walk up to another man who you've never met to disrespect him and his wife. Again, in front of their daughter.

Poirier smacked the man as the sign guy seemingly held up his hand for a high-five. Yes, a high-five. "Hey Poirier, f*ck your wife! Also, can I get a selfie?"

Then when Sign Guy flipped Poirier off, Dustin wanted to get out of the truck but was talked out of it. It was for the best. Someone who is that big of a dickhead would be the first to call the cops. Poke someone with a stick. Then when the person you are poking with a stick reacts like they are tired of being poked with a stick, claim you were the one assaulted.

Dustin Poirier doesn't have a fight lined up as of this writing. Sign Guy probably went home to play on his burner accounts on Twitter.
